data.title: Agency Services
data.meta_description: The official website of the New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission.
data.text:
Licensing Centers

In Licensing Centers, we are processing license transactions only. Appointments are required for:

First-time license/permit (REAL ID or standard). If available, you can take your knowledge test at your permit appointment.

Upgrade your class D license to a CDL

Knowledge test for auto, CDL or motorcycle.

Out-of-state transfer.

Renewal of license/ID, CDL, TVRs (temporary visa restricted licenses), or any other expiring license.

You can renew online

You can make a renewal appointment starting 3 months prior to your expiration date.

You can get a REAL ID at any renewal appointment.

Upgrade to REAL ID

You do not need an appointment for any of the following, which can be done on a walk-in basis at any Licensing Center.

Name change

Gender marker change

Probationary license (after passing road test)

Disability placard (initial or renewal)

License plate return (most locations have a drop box)

License/ID replacements, or changes of address can be done online at NJMVC.gov.

Hours of operation (except holidays):

Monday 8:00 a.m.- 4:30 p.m.

Tuesday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Wednesday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Thursday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Friday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Saturday 8:00 a.m. -3:00 p.m.

Vehicle Centers

In Vehicle Centers, we are processing vehicle transactions only. Appointments are required for:

Registration/title transfer for private sale of a new vehicle, boat or trailer

New registration/title

Salvage title

License plate transfer or replacement

Replacement or duplicate title.

Renewal of registration.

You can make a renewal appointment starting 3 months prior to your expiration date.

You can also renew online.

You do not need an appointment for the following, which can be done on a walk-in basisÂ at any Vehicle Center.

Disability placard (initial or renewal)

License plate return (most locations have a drop box).

Hours of operation (except holidays):

Monday 8:00 a.m.- 4:30 p.m.

Tuesday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Wednesday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Thursday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Friday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

Saturday 8:00 a.m. -3:00 p.m.

Road Test Facilities

A road test may be taken once the knowledge and vision tests are successfully completed, at a driver testing center.

An appointment is needed to take a road test. You may schedule an appointment online; or in person at a driver testing center.

Note: Commercial Driver License (CDL) road tests can only be scheduled in-person at a Driver Testing Center.

Hours of operation (except holidays):

Monday â Friday 8:00 a.m. â 4:00 p.m.

Regional Service Centers

A customer may “walk-in” to one of our six Regional Service Centers (Eatontown, Newark, Paterson, Trenton, Wayne, or West Deptford) to

get information regarding driving records, “points” for driving violations, and insurance surcharges

resolve outstanding court suspensions and restore driving privileges

pay restoration, surcharge, dishonored check, and program fees

review registration records and certified driver abstracts (five-year certified driving records); and other certified documents.

A customer will require a “driver conference”, or scheduled service appointment, when more assistance is required to resolve an issue. This includes:

persons with a proposed suspension of driving and/or vehicle registration privileges

persons who claim to be victims of identity theft, misuse, or fraud

drivers with cases in need of a thorough official record review and decision

those who require an identification verification hearing.

Appointments may be scheduled by visiting any Regional Service Center.

Hours of operation (except holidays):

Monday â Friday 8:00 a.m. â 4:30 p.m.Â
